name: Proxima Centauri
description: The closest known star to the Sun, located in the Alpha Centauri star system. Proxima Centauri is a red dwarf and is not visible to the naked eye.

name: Betelgeuse
description: A massive red supergiant star in the constellation Orion, Betelgeuse is one of the largest visible stars and is nearing the end of its life. It may eventually explode as a supernova.

name: Stephenson 2-18
description: Currently considered the largest known star by radius and volume, Stephenson 2-18 is a red supergiant in the constellation of Ara. It is a contender for the largest star in terms of size.

name: Sirius
description: The brightest star in the night sky, Sirius is a binary star system consisting of a white main-sequence star (Sirius A) and a faint white dwarf (Sirius B).

name: Alpha Centauri A
description: The primary component of the Alpha Centauri star system, Alpha Centauri A is a yellow main-sequence star that is slightly larger and more luminous than the Sun.

name: Alpha Centauri B
description: The secondary star in the Alpha Centauri system, Alpha Centauri B is a smaller, dimmer orange star, orbiting close to Alpha Centauri A.

name: Vega
description: A bright star in the Lyra constellation, Vega is one of the most studied stars and is often used as a reference point for the definition of the standard for brightness (magnitude) in astronomy.

name: Arcturus
description: The fourth-brightest star in the night sky, Arcturus is a red giant in the constellation Bo√∂tes. It has a much larger radius than the Sun and is nearing the end of its main-sequence life.
